title: CatBoostClassifier: SHAP values don't add up to the output
body:
Hello ðŸ™‚ 

I am using shap to explain the outputs of a CatBoostClassifier. I noticed that the SHAP values don't add up to the outputs of the model.

I was surprised because I thought shap was checking the additivity (`check_additivity=True`) but this check is only done when using XGBoost.

I tried to force a test by stopping with pdb [there](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L377) and in the console running `model_output_vals = self.model.original_model.predict(X, prediction_type="RawFormulaVal")`. This allowed me to run the `assert_additivity` method [there](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L378), which failed.

I think there is a reason why you don't perform this test in the code, and maybe I am wrong somewhere (wrong `prediction_type`?). Could you help me understand what is going wrong there or which mistake I did?

Thank you!

Some additional precisions:
- My model receives both categorical and numerical features, the goal is binary classification
- This issue might be related: https://github.com/catboost/catboost/issues/1125
